channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Ex-Patients’ Club
item.description: Laura Delano walked away from the treatments that defined her teens and 20s. Now, she’s hoping to create a road map for others to follow.

item.title: Telegram’s Pavel Durov, Charged With Range of Crimes, Is Allowed to Leave France
item.description: Pavel Durov said that the investigation into illicit activity on the messaging app he runs is ongoing, but that he had returned home to Dubai.

item.title: Board burnout is a major risk to all companies—Here’s how they can protect their top directors
item.description: There are three critical steps boards can take to protect their top people, according to experts.

item.title: Bill Gates says Satya Nadella was ‘almost’ passed over for Microsoft CEO role
item.description: Bill Gates said he always backed Satya Nadella to lead Microsoft, but the current CEO was "almost" passed over in the succession process.

item.title: In North Macedonia, Officials Investigate Lapses in Deadly Nightclub Fire
item.description: At least 59 people died and more than 150 were injured in the inferno. The authorities said the venue’s hospitality permit had been issued illegally.

item.title: Netanyahu’s Move to Fire Shin Bet Chief Reflects Wider Push for Control
item.description: The effort is part of a dispute between Benjamin Netanyahu’s right-wing alliance and its opponents about the nature and future of the Israeli state.

item.title: Trump Says Biden’s Pardons are ‘Void’ and ‘Vacant’ Because of Autopen
item.description: The use of the autopen, a device that reproduces signatures and is ubiquitous in government and business, is ordinarily uncontroversial. There is no p...

item.title: TON surges 24% as Telegram founder Pavel Durov returns home to Dubai amid ongoing investigation
item.description: “The process is ongoing, it feels great to be home,” Durov wrote on Telegram Monday.

item.title: Trump’s Plan to Discuss Ukraine’s Power Plants With Putin Prompts Questions
item.description: The call, scheduled for Tuesday, will be the first known conversation between the two leaders since Mr. Putin laid out numerous conditions for a cease...

item.title: Tariffs won’t make America great again: Export-Import Bank former chairman and president
item.description: The American economy runs on trade. With his tariffs and trade wars, Trump risks stopping the engine of U.S. prosperity.

item.title: Trump’s Plan to Discuss Ukraine’s Power Plants With Putin Prompts Questions
item.description: The call, scheduled for Tuesday, will be the first known conversation between the two leaders since Mr. Putin laid out numerous conditions for a cease...

item.title: Democracy Is on the Line in Israel and America
item.description: The rule of law is in danger in both America and Israel if some red lines are not drawn and defended.

item.title: How South Sudan Returned to the Brink of War
item.description: An attack on a U.N. helicopter has highlighted rising tensions in the world’s youngest country, where a seven-year-old peace deal looks ever more frag...

item.title: Foreign tourism into the U.S. is suddenly reversing and is now expected to drop, due in part to ‘polarizing Trump administration policies and rhetoric’
item.description: Tourism Economics President Adam Sacks said in the two weeks since the report came out, the situation has deteriorated further.
